intro: Hieracium pesianum, commonly known as the Persian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing yellow petals that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium pesianum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
